page.title: 05FARMING IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {GLIDDEN FARM {ACREAGE}-385 acres,100 acres woodland. The farm has been there since the turn of the century. {OWNER}-Mr. Silvester.Six people work on the farm 3 family- 3 living nearby {RESIDENTIAL DWELLINGS}-6 houses. {TYPE OF FARMING}-Dairy/Arable-equally. Supplying Gauntletts Dairy.Young poultry sold to suppliers and a small amount of eggs too.Sheep are reared for wool.{LIVESTOCK}-116 dairy cows,3 bulls, 32 heifers, 36 bulling heifers, 6 steers, 30 yearling steers, 71 calves, 30 ewes, 1 ram, 54 lambs, 20,000 chicks, 3 geese, 2 goslings and 7 dogs.{CROPS}-wheat and barley. {MACHINERY}-Approx.40 farm machines. {BUILDINGS}-Used for storing machinery, as calf sheds and dairy sheds.There are cowyards and a milking area.
